definition: both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
surname Li
sharp/favorable/advantage/benefit/profit/interest/to do good to/to benefit
surname Shuang
two/double/pair/both/even (number)
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: They all say she is stepping on her road to fames and fortunes.
sentences.chinese: 大家都说她正走上名利双收的路上。

sentences.english: Which career will ensure both fame and wealth for you?
sentences.chinese: 哪种职业可确保你名利双收？

sentences.english: While waiting for the fame and fortune, but also sorrow without love?
sentences.chinese: 等名利双收的时候，还愁没有爱情？

sentences.english: All make you money 24 hours non-stop, laugh do not cage mouth, fame and fortune.
sentences.chinese: 一切让你24小时赚钱不停，笑不笼嘴，名利双收。

sentences.english: " valedictory air conditioning heating" Let front still gained much acclaim this year.
sentences.chinese: “告别空调暖气”让锋尚在今年名利双收。

sentences.english: I want fame and riches in my life.
sentences.chinese: 我想在生活中名利双收。

definition: to win success and recognition (idiom)
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
to earn
undertaking/project/activity/(charitable, political or revolutionary) cause/publicly funded institution, enterprise or foundation/career/occupation/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to be successful in business/professional success
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
flushed with success/proud of one's success (in exams, promotion etc)/as pleased as punch
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
becoming more prosperous with each passing day
to earn a fortune
to hit the big time
